name: sfchronicle
text: We need an attitude adjustment, says Dr. David Spiegel, medical director of the Stanford Center on Stress and Health — and universal sick leave. https://t.co/n2C8hy2LWi

name: sfchronicle
text: Across the Bay Area, residents are envisioning how a region at its breaking point can use this tumultuous moment to rebuild a more equitable society. https://t.co/8T8p8nsRlY

name: sfchronicle
text:
The SF Giants and Oakland A’s hope to welcome fans back to their ballparks in 2021, if health officials permit. But developing a plan is difficult when nobody can predict how many spectators will be allowed in or how many will feel comfortable returning.
https://t.co/w9yak7cQdz

name: sfchronicle
text:
A low-income family does not have to include state payments to care for a mentally ill child as part of its income for Section 8 housing eligibility, the state Supreme Court ruled Monday.
https://t.co/Zau4qtYhjH

name: sfchronicle
text: “As we analyze how our workplace will change in a post-COVID world, we are specifically rethinking where future employees could be based,” said Todd Morgenfeld, Pinterest’s chief financial officer, in a statement.  https://t.co/X3xk6rPJEe

name: sfchronicle
text: What happened to the A’s and the 49ers from Sunday to Monday morning proves everyone must remain vigilant about the coronavirus, says @AnnKillion:  https://t.co/MX9juKYBXQ

name: sfchronicle
text: “We need to rethink how scheduled children are,” Leyla Bologlu, a pediatric neuropsychologist in San Francisco says. “How many adults work more than 8 or 10 hours? We ask our children to work those hours.” https://t.co/FWQTRZUesO

name: sfchronicle
text:
For diehard Giants fan, Emily Doskow, a coronavirus vaccine is a must before returning to Oracle Park. Others would attend a game right now. What will it take for fans to feel safe in the new normal?
https://t.co/76EATWk7gU

name: sfchronicle
text: At a time when meatless restaurants are becoming increasingly common in the Bay Area, Lion Dance Cafe is gaining serious buzz as the next must-visit vegan destination — and it’s officially opening Sept. 12 in downtown Oakland. https://t.co/piun51bZmm

name: sfchronicle
text:
Full containment may be in sight for the three major wildfires burning in Northern California. 

Here's what we know: https://t.co/xHeSvApagr

name: sfchronicle
text:
Federal judge upholds California’s open-carry ban, as demonstrations increasingly draw gun-wielding counter-protesters.

Story by @BobEgelko: https://t.co/Oje9G5Co0e

name: sfchronicle
text:
After a change in state coronavirus rules on Friday, seven Bay Area counties — Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Mateo, Solano, Sonoma and Santa Clara — reopened indoor malls, hair salons and barbershops with limited capacity.
https://t.co/9f4RzPzymN

name: sfchronicle
text:
More than one person a day died in SF of an overdose last year. This year is expected to be worse.

Story by @TrishaThadani: https://t.co/8YS9sFffgq

name: sfchronicle
text: There are 3,100 inmates spread across 43 fire camps in California, with 2,200 of them qualified to work on fire lines and the rest providing support for the camps, reports @hknightsf: https://t.co/4IcUKgssB9

name: sfchronicle
text: A new documentary film explores what food sovereignty means to Native American communities after generations of being forced to give up their language, culture and food traditions. https://t.co/uguiQ6Bu9R

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: Magnitude 7 earthquake strikes near the coast of Atacama, Chile. 

https://t.co/6qE6zfCHN8
